title: Introduction to Computer Science
description: Teaches how to design, develop, reason about, and test programs. Topics include higher-order functions, object-oriented programming, recursion, algorithms, data structures, decomposition, interpreters, and regular expressions.

title: Exploring Computer Science
description: Introduction to the discipline of computer science and its fields.

title: Introduction to Computer Systems
description: How a computer works to execute sequential code.

title: Data Structures and Algorithms
description: Fundamental data structures and algorithms of computer science.

title: Discrete Data Structures
description: Fundamentals of logic, proofs, sets, functions, relations, and combinatorics for computer science.

title: Advanced Techniques in Human Computer Interaction
description: Explores advanced HCI principles, usability testing, and user-centered design techniques.

title: Ethics & Computers in Society
description: Examines ethical, social, and legal issues in computing and technology.

title: Advanced Software Construction
description: Data structures, algorithms, memory management, and software engineering principles.

title: How to Program
description: Introduction to programming and computer science for those with no prior programming experience.

title: Intro to Data Science
description: This course is a broad, interdisciplinary look at the field of data science, and how to derive insight from data.

title: Exploring CS
description: Introduction to the discipline of computer science and its fields.

title: Academic Internship
description: Internships or cooperative education experiences with organizations outside BYU.

title: Software Engineering Lab 1
description: The first of three experiential learning labs that will provide students with hands-on experience

title: Database Principles
description: Fundamentals of database design and SQL programming.

title: Introduction to Computational Theory
description: Introduction to front-end and back-end web technologies.

title: Software Engineering Lab 2
description: The second of three experiential learning labs that provide students with hands-on experience with software engineering tools and techniques.

title: Software Engineering Lab 3
description: The third of three experiential learning labs that provide students with hands-on experience with software engineering tools and techniques.

title: Web Programming
description: Introduction to web application design and implementation. Both front-end and back-end development with an emphasis on REST architectures.

title: Introduction to Machine Learning
description: Fundamentals of machine learning models such as neural networks, decision trees, clustering, Bayesian learning, and reinforcement learning.

title: Algorithm Design and Analysis
description: A study of algorithm design including dynamic programming, graph algorithms, divide-and-conquer, and intelligent search.

title: Systems Programming
description: Principles of systems programming, including Linux programming, multiprocessing, concurrency, caching, and network protocols.

title: Testing, Analysis, and Verification
description: Software quality techniques including testing, static analysis, and verification at various software development stages.

title: Operating Systems Design
description: Principles and concepts of operating systems design including concurrency, memory management, and scheduling.

title: Interactive Graphics and Image Processing
description: Basic concepts of computer graphics, image processing algorithms, and 3D rendering fundamentals.

title: Advanced Algorithms and Problem Solving
description: Improving problem-solving skills and preparation for technical/coding interviews through algorithmic challenges.

title: Software Engineering
description: Analysis, design, implementation, and testing of significant software systems.

title: Computer Vision
description: Introduction to fundamental concepts and algorithms of computer vision including feature extraction and image recognition.

title: Computer Networks
description: Introduction to data communication, network protocols, and architecture.

title: Computer Security
description: Introduction to computer security including authentication, encryption, and security protocols.

title: Artificial Intelligence
description: Core AI topics including search, knowledge representation, learning, and reasoning.
